title: World War II — European Theater
key_facts: Began with Germany’s invasion of Poland in 1939
Blitzkrieg campaigns across Western and Northern Europe
Turning points: Battle of Britain, Stalingrad, Kursk
Allied landings in Normandy (D-Day) and liberation of Western Europe
Fall of Berlin and Nazi Germany’s surrender in May 1945
causes: Revisionist aims of Nazi Germany and Fascist Italy
Appeasement and failure of collective security
Aftermath of World War I and economic instability
outcome: Allied occupation and division of Germany
impacts: Redrawing of European borders and the onset of the Cold War
Mass displacement and reconstruction across Europe
Formation of the United Nations and European integration

sources.title: European theatre of World War II
